title: USS Midway Museum, San Diego
address: 910 N. Harbor Drive, San Diego, CA 92101
review_list:
What an absolutely fabulous tribute to history! We spent a solid afternoon touring and were most impressed with the knowledgeable volunteers who brought our experience to the next level. We had a nice lunch at the Fantail Cafe and found the gift shop to have a great variety with reasonable prices. Don't miss a visit to the USS Midway when...


More  



decided to try this attraction and were so happy we did. The history and inner workings of such a large ship are breath taking.

On a visit to San Diego for a beer festival we took a Friday to explore the USS Midway and were glad we did. We got the ear phone tour which really gave a lot of information about the ship and history. The ship is an aircraft carrier and is very big and we went deep into the floors and...


More  



Great way to spend a day. If you want the full experience, count on 5+ hours.
You can get off and come back on, but there is food places to eat on board.
The retired Navy Vets offer out all the stories & experiences you can want.
Starry with the movie and then take the bridge tour.
Great for kids!

One day is not enough unless you arrive super early. So many things to view. You literally walk around for hours. I took my 8yr old and my 3 yr old. They loved it and want to go back. I also enjoyed it. It's fun for all ages. The staff is very friendly and knowledgable. Great history. If you are...


More  



Even if your not into ships or any thing Naval, this is a must see attraction. What a fantastic insight into the live of the USA navy. The ship is fully interactive and has so much to do you need a full day to visit. One word of wrning wear comforatble shoes, there plenty of walking, I would not recommed...


More  



There aren't too many chances to visit aircraft carriers and despite the age of the Midway, it's still impressive. From the cramped quarters, to the scale of the decades old engineering, to the great view across the bay to the latest generation of carriers this is a visit worth doing. My grandpa used to take me round the Imperial War...


More  



I am not nuts about war history, or war ships, or war planes... but I was impressed by the scope of information available.
The history of the planes, and what made them special was intriguing. However, it was the detailed description by the volunteers that made the difference.
I think his name was John Ryan. The way he talked about...


More  



Visited the USS during my short weekend trip to San Diego and it was worth it. It's very interesting seeing how sailors lived on the ship and what their day to day activities were. Definitely recommend seeing the short 15 min film on the battle of Midway. A must see if visiting SD.

Great learning experience. The staff and veterans were extremely helpful. I did not have enough time to do the whole tour but I was very impressed.

title: San Diego Zoo, San Diego
address: 2929 Zoo Drive, San Diego, CA 92101
review_list:
Visited on a Monday after spending the previous day at the Safari Park. We were still exhausted so had only planned on staying for a couple hours. However, once we entered, everything was so well put together that we ended up spending the whole day. The staff were all friendly, from the retail and food service employees to the volunteers...

I am from Omaha so we frequent the Henry Doorly zoo often. Sorry but the Omaha zoo rules! SD zoo has the adorable pandas and koalas plus the natural southern California vegetation which was something new to see. Seemed like too many twists and turns then having to backtrack which can be irritating. Just go to the Omaha zoo and...

The SD Zoo is a wonderful zoo and conservation area. The polar bears and the pandas were the highlight but friendly staff and the carefully thought out habitats made it enjoyable. By your tickets on the mobile app and save time by walking past the ticket line. If you have a coupon just entire the bar code number to apply...

I hate to part with money (ask my friends and family) but $50 per head is worth it at this zoo.
There was free parking near the zoo parking lot! Easy way to the entrance. Well organized lines.

I was here this last weekend. Took my grandson, he's 13 months old. Probably too small to really enjoy everything, but we did find activities he was interested in. This place is just beautiful. All of the animals look well taken care of, the grounds are lovely, and the temperature is just right to see some great activity. The San Diego Zoo was just awesome! Not enough can be said about how great this zoo is. They continue to be a top place on our list to return to repeatedly.

San Diego zoo has it all. From flamingos, to pandas, lions and muskrats. It's an incredible experience. Being from Canada and never seeing a polar bear before going to this zoo was a little weird. But we learned so much about animals all over the world.

We visited the park with two three month olds.
The park was well prepared for lil' ones. They had a mother room for heating bottles near the park entrance. We found labeled bathrooms with changing tables easily. There were lots of nooks to feed in and be outside, but away from people starring. It was also very easy to move...

We enjoyed visiting the San Diego Zoo. My adult daughter, who is a zookeeper at a small AZA zoo in North Carolina, visited the zoo with us and she was very impressed. title: Balboa Park, San Diego
address: 1549 El Prado, San Diego, CA 92101
review_list:
This is a must see in San Diego. I have been three times and still have not seen everything this place has to offer. Beautiful gardens, museums, hikes, etc. My top pick for places to see in SD. Not to be missed. You can pay to see things or do a ton of things for free. What a gem

Right next to SD zoo we walked over and wandered around the various musuems. Quite the variety for many interests. So many people (and dogs) to watch and take in the scenery.

Balboa Park is the go to spot to relax, look at beautiful architecture, enjoy museums, and play with hula hoops. Sometimes there are activities for kids and even grown-up's, just like the nice man who had a bunch of hula hoops for anyone who wanted to take a break.

The park is great. You can walk. Go to a organ concert. Go to museums. Enjoy nature. Sit in the sun and read a book.

I spent an enjoyable couple of hours strolling through Balboa Park with my daughter. She's recently moved to San Diego, and I wanted to see some of the places near where she lives. I was really impressed! First of all, the park is HUGE! We barely scratched the surface while we were there. There are museums and other things to...


More  



We were staying at Mission Beach for a family Vacation with 9 people ranging in age from a new born to mid 60's, 3 generations. Went to the park with the intention to go to a museum but it was so pleasant out that we just wandered around to various gardens and sites. Went back with just the two of...


More  



Balboa park is a great place to visit and people watch. With many museums and promenades Balboa Park offers an array of choices to delight the mind and eye. The eggshell Pavilion hosts weddings and "Quincenaeras with lots of beautiful and handsome young folks posing for pictures. We enjoyed capuchinos and a delightful Lemon flan at the Cafe Del Prado...


More  



Lots to see and do. Was only able to spend one day but enjoyed every minute. For those with dogs be sure to take your pooch to the dog park. Parking is a little difficult but you will find a place so keep searching. Beautiful gardens to explore and the architecture is breathtaking.

Fantastic place to go on a budget. You can walk around and be entertained for hours.
There are always fun things going on all around the park.
Some of the museums are free.

Such a wonderful place to take a stroll through after coming out of the museums. Walked through the park and I was happy to see that it was so lively!
You could walk here for days!
Definitely a must in San Diego!

title: Torrey Pines State Reserve, San Diego
address: Coast Highway 101, San Diego, CA 92037
review_list:
You can park your car and walk through countless trails. Stunning views of the ocean. There is a hike down to the beach where you can walk along the shore in your bare feet or with shoes and explore the stunning California Coast. Spent almost a whole day here looking around.

This is a great hike. There are several trails so you can choose whatever suits you. You can also choose to drive to the top if you like. There is a fee to park in the park. There are some public spaces outside of the park which are free, but they fill early.
The park has several different trails. I...


More  



If you're in the mood for a walk and wanting to see an incredible view, nice place to walk. Torrey Pines and other flora are beautiful.

A must see in San Diego. The views over the Pacific are incredible. An amazing hike. Lots to see and with luck whales and dolphins are spotted. The Torrey Pines are so amazing. Great hike, beach walk and climb!

This is a very beautiful park with a lovely beach and gorgeous overlook. If you get there early enough you can snag a free parking spot on the main road. If, like us, you get there later in the day, expect to pay a lot for parking.

Great views, variety of trails from long to hard to easy, and even some wheelchair accessible. Easy access from the highway, large parking lot. I will be visiting again.

You cannot beat the location and the views. Just stunning and free!! Well marked paths run along Torrey Pines reserve. Many hills, so can be challenging, but my 9yo and 12yo had no problems The vistas took our collective breaths away. AND FOR FREE!!!

went to blacks beach. better to take the stairs!!! they should do steps...although i heard there are some a walk away. Get Naked!!!

Just a week ago we visited this for the first time. The park charges 10 dollars to go up the hill and park on top. Once there we took a trail that had beautiful views of the ocean but this trail was a dirt path that wound down to the beach and that meant a rather steep climb that was...


More  



Hike to sweeping views of the ocean. The trails offer information on native plants and historical data. Interesting, hot, dusty, crowded. Bring your own refreshments!

title: La Jolla Cove, La Jolla
address: 1100 Coast Blvd, La Jolla, San Diego, CA 92037
review_list:
No sandy beach to sit on really and the water gets deep quickly. You're sharing the water with seals --a plus for us but maybe not for everyone!

If you're not from CA, this is an incredible opportunity to get up close to the sea lions. They come right up to the beach and sun themselves. They also hang out on rocks around the cove. Fantastic.

I love this place. The community is adorable and rich with history. There is a little mid-town park with a unique flair. There are caves near the water where the sea lions like to spend their time. If you're a Dr. Suess fan (like me), go into the store with one of his characters out in the front. They'll tell...


More  



It smells like fish which was gross but the view was AMAZING! It was exciting to watch the pups follow their mom. However we did spot a pup who couldn't find their mom and it was sad to leave without knowing what was going on 😔

Each time I come down to visit, I find another reason to love this place! There are several gorgeous view points all along the area, There is a trail from one end to the other along the top of the cliffs next to the ocean. You can see dolphins, lots of sea lions and flocks of pelicans and other sea...


More  



This just a respite by the sea. Thoroughly enjoyed daily walks around this area - to see the waves, birds, seals and a couple of whales. Wonderful!

I LOVE Lajolla. It's so beautiful. We went in February, and the water was cold, but that didn't stop us from jumping in and swimming with the seals. IN FACT, most tourists stayed on land, while we climbed down the rocks to our ALMOST SECLUDED beach. It really was breath taking. We packed a lunch, had some wine..... PERFECT! Witnessed...


More  



When we were there, it was very, very crowded. But people there were friendly and mostly from places other than here. It was really fun visiting.

La Jolla Cove has breath taking views. One may stroll along the coast and enjoy seeing the lovely homes in the area, as well as sea life.

Beautiful view of the ocean.. We saw many seals being playful while some were also resting. There are many places for that perfect picture! The sound of the ocean waves hitting the rocks is so soothing. If you get lucky you might be able to catch some up close pictures with the seals.

title: Cabrillo National Monument, San Diego
address: 1800 Cabrillo Memorial Drive, San Diego, CA 92106
review_list:
I have visited a number of national monuments but this one has the most beautiful view of them all. Standing high above where the ocean meets San diego bay is not only a beautiful statue of Cabrillo but an impressive view of the bay and city. You can spend hours watching all kind of ships and air planes from this...


More  



The views are fantastic here. We watched a 20 minute movie about local sea life and it was so interesting. The gift shop is full of fun stuff to look at or buy. We didn't know what we were getting into going up here, and it turned out to be a highlight of our trip to San Diego.

This is such a fun adventure! You learn cool things. You get exercise walking. You get sunshine galore! The views take your breath away! It was a fun, happy, different thing to do. GO! And just a tip...get there early because the sun gets warmer and the lines get longer!

On the point of land forming the north curve of land enclosing SD bay and naval harbor -- Cabrillo Point is a National Monument to our military. Reached after driving through the edge of a naval base and cemetery up to the point with a lighthouse and vista point. And the vistas are exceptional in more than 180 degrees. (Added...


More  



I have heard amazing things about the views from here but unfortunately we showed up about 3 minutes after 5:00 and did not get in. We planned on being there for the 5:30ish sunset but unfortunately didn't get to see it and because we saved it for our last night we didn't get to go back. Next time! We did...


More  



Pay the $10 admission to see a very historic site and park and enjoy the beautiful views. While we didn't take the time to do there is a great trail 2.5 miles round trip ..

Loved going down to the Tide Pools. We were really lucky as we were there during low tide. The kids will love looking for shells and fish.

Great for everyone and so worth it!
$10 charge to get in and you get:
1) Rosecrans military cemetery
2) Point Loma lighthouses-- old and new
3) tide pools down the hill

Yes, see the films in the auditorium. The Juan C film is terrific as it follows his voyage up...

Visited here for an hour after arriving at the airport to start our San Diego vacation. The drive up was lovely and the views were glorious. It was quiet, and easy to read all of the plaques describing the history of the explorer and the construction of the lighthouse.

Great place to see sail boats and a fantastic view. Some hiking trails. The lighthouse is small but cute and worth a tour. The museum isn't great but offers some of the best views in San Diego of the harbor.
Destination for cyclists. For those who want a bit more challenge, ride down (then back up) to the tide pools.

title: Petco Park, San Diego
address: 100 Park Boulevard, San Diego, CA 92101
review_list:
This is a great open set ballpark. Allows strolling outside with views inside. Baseball, college basketball and winter events held here. Worth a stop when in San Dieg.

Petco Park offers a behind the scenes tour of the stadium. You get to sit in the dugout and visit areas that are usually off-limits for most fans. The best part was seeing paintings of the best players to ever wear a Padres uniform: Tony Gwynn, Dave Winfield, Benito Santiago, Travor Hoffman and more. Our tour guide was extremely knowledgeable...


More  



So not being a huge baseball fan I don't go to games very often, and when I do it is for the social aspect and not for what's going on down on the field. Blasphemy, I know. I love that Petco has a number of actual restaurants in the park and a variety of things to keep you busy if...


More  



Petco Park is a really nice and well designed.
Pros: Plenty of choices for food and drink, plenty of women's bathrooms, nice decor, open and airy. Plenty of staff to help direct you. Good choice of sunny or shady seats. Special area for kids to hang out on the grass. Good variety of seat prices.
Cons: Restricted restaurant access, only...


More  



No bad seats and right next to most hotels and the Gas Lamp District with lots of restaurants. This stadium has some of the best ballpark food I have eaten. The Gas Lamp Marriott Hotel roof lounge looks right down into the stadium and the Fox Sports Bar & Grill is great and right next door.

fun and entertaining, but where is the baseball? too many kids think this is baseball, and the Padres help reinforce it. good time, but they kept interrupting the fun with baseball, or at least I think it was, parking at a premium, ride a bike and save.

It's not Fenway Park, but nobody expects it to be. Petco Park is in a perfect downtown location, has a public park in the outfield, and there's not a bad seat in the house. One of the best parks in the league!

Modern baseball park. This location can be on the cool side due to being located on the bay. Seats are typical baa park seating. The seats get very hard after an hour.

Petco Park Stadium is really nice! I love that security is strictly in forced and they don't tolerate stupid behavior like most stadiums do! Love that they have the Supercross here

Home of the San Diego Padres, PETCO Park is one of the best ballparks to watch a game in. Having been to many major league ballparks, this one rates in the top 5 in my opinion. There really isn't a bad seat in the house, and if you are interested in local cuisine, there is much to choose from in...


More

title: Sunset Cliffs Natural Park, San Diego
address: 1253 Sunset Cliffs Blvd, San Diego, CA 92107
review_list:
My BF and I went here for our first date. The sun was going down and I wanted to view the sunset. We drove to Sunset Cliffs and watched the sun set on a glorious S. California day here. I don't think I will ever forget how this moment felt. It was magic.

In the morning we paid for parking at the bottom of the cliffs and walked up the long hill to the hiking trails with spectacular views and lots of people enjoying their morning hikes. It took about an hour and was relaxing and not too hard of a hike. There a different trails to take and the park is very...


More  



Tough to find parking in some areas, but worth the effort. Make sure it's a clear morning and the fog burns off before you go. The sunshine make it all the more spectacular.

Came here after reading reviews. So glad we did. The views of the sunset was absolutely stunning and we seen a marriage proposal!! :D

Beautiful breathtaking view. I loved it. It is scary getting down there because you literally are climbing down a rope that is tied to a rock but it is worth it. Slippery rocks though so be careful.

I love watching the ocean from here and taking a stroll along the cliff tops. I feel so happy to have family living in the area so I can visit often.

My friend walked me up here just to see the sunset. It's a beautiful
view looking down to the ocean.

The view is beautiful. Must see. I think the best time to be there is spring or summer, we went during winter, but it was still very beautiful. Just sit and stare for half an hour. Clean ocean air and beautiful view.

If you're in San Diego, do yourself a favor and watch the sun set from Sunset Cliffs. There will probably be a good number of people (at least there were when we were there), but it doesn't feel too crowded since you can walk a good way in either direction. We parked in a nearby neighborhood and walked one block...

We went on Valentine's Day left it a bit late but got there 20 mins before sunset. Found a parking spot quickly as there are constantly people coming in and leaving the various parking spots (the one we went to on the cliff was free...side note - if you are a tourist like us do your research on parking you...

title: Fort Rosecrans Cemetery, San Diego
address: 1800 Cabrillo Memorial Drive, San Diego, CA 92106
review_list:
This is definitely a place to see. So beautiful and breath taking. I need to inquiry about tours of the cemetery as I'm sure there is a lot of history there. The cemetery grounds are immaculate and the lighthouse and views from there are amazing.

Beautiful resting spot for service veteran's. Great job to the maintenance staff, the place looked very well tended.
Appreciated the 3rd ID, Rock of the Marne remembrance stone. It also made me happy that most of this sailors, soilders, marines and airmen lived long lives...so many veteran's cemetery's only have the ones who made the ultimate sacrifice. Their youth and...


More  



My family and I watched the sunset from here... The cabrillo monument close by was closed when we got there but the views we got from this cemetery were beautiful.
The cemetery itself is actually a very calming place. Reading the names on the stones makes you take a minute to think about their service and appreciate what we have...


More  



The lines of markers are endless here at Rosecrans. It is awe inspiring and truly humbling. We have always wanted to visit as a birding experience but were amazed at the scope of this reverent place.

It's on the way to old lighthouse and cabrillo national monument.
Stop here and breathe thanks for those that serve in the military. Wish we didn't have military cemeteries...too many young who have died.
Love the peacefulness and views.
Outa room so no more interments.
Really nothing special but show respect and stop here...if only for the views.

As serene and peaceful as a meditation garden, I find Fort Rosecrans National Cemetery to be one of the most beautiful spots in San Diego. High atop a hilly peninsula on the southernmost tip in the community of Pt Loma, it is well worth a visit. We live in San Diego County and bi-monthly trips to a family member's gravesite...

We stumbled upon the cemetery by accident on our way to the Point Loma Lighthouse and we were so happy we did. What a humbling and inspiring place to remember those who fought and died to protect us. I was glad that my children could experience the reverence in person. They roamed in silence and read the stories of the...


More  



My wife's WWII vet husband picked his burial spot in advance so he overlooks the ocean. After all he suffered as a POW he certainly deserves it. She goes up to chat with him periodically.

Take a moment or more to stop and honor those who rest here. A beautiful setting and a wonderful tribute to our nation's heroes.

This is one of the nicest kept and awe inspiring resting place for the people who protected our country.. Incredible views and just an amazing place to visit and pay respects to those who served our country.

title: Point Loma, San Diego
address: San Diego, CA
review_list:
We paid $5 for entrance into the Naval entrance of Point Loma. It has the light house up there and a museum to walk through if interested but the real reason is the views form both side over the ocean and down town San Diego. They have trails to beach and on the cliffs for spectacular views. It gets windy...


More  



You can see Coronado island and downtown from here. This is the one location you have to visit! In fact this was the only place I visited while I was there other than work stuff.

Point Loma is one of those places that you will never forget! The views are stunning...there's an interesting history, and as a two-fer... the lighthouse is also co-located with the Point Loma Visitor center. Great documentaries are shown in the theater and the museum provides just enough of a taste of the explorers who have been there before. If you...


More  



You can see soo far across the water & the sailboats are so quiet & relaxing moving around in the water.

We started at the tidal pools which are usually a favorite of ours but these were disappointing. Maybe the sea was too rough but we were there at low tide. The light house was wonderful and the views of the bay fantastic.

Under-the-radar attraction that will blow your mind. The most spectacular view there is. You can walk around or watch a movie at the Visitors Center, bring own food if you like. Enjoy the view !

The views at Point Loma are fantastic. Just sitting having a drink overlooking the ocean was a great way to relax and enjoy the views.

This was a lovely extension of our tour of Point Loma Nazarene College. Fantastic bicycling with views south to Mexico, out over the Pacific and across the bay and harbor to the downtown skyline. Definitely a must see. Plus, there is a small visitor center up high and you can drop down to the Pacific shore to check out the...


More  



One of the most amazing places I have seen. The atmosphere is worth the drive. I would definitely recommend this.

The view is breathtaking. If you are really lucky, the Navy will have a ship set sail and pass below just for you.

title: Mount Soledad, La Jolla
address: 6905 La Jolla Scenic Drive South, La Jolla, San Diego, CA 92037
review_list:
Loved Mount Soledad! All branches of military are represented in the memorials, it was wonderful to spend time reading about service people from the Civil War to present day. The 360 degree view is amazing! Spend 1-2 hours, bring a picnic lunch, porta potties on site.

Amazing view of the Pacific Ocean, San Diego, La Jolla, worth a visit! Great stop for a picnic, photos.

Friends had taken us up the mountain the night before after sunset. It was breath taking but I drove up just before sunrise the next day. Exhilarating experience. Very peaceful even with the traffic sounds from below.

Great place for pictures, a panoramic view of the area. On a clear day you can see Mexico.
The military memorial was well done with lots of photos and information about each service person, some famous.
Clean park, but parking is very limited at the top.

It was quiet when we visited, and we could sit and look at 360 degrees of amazing scenery. The drive up the insanely steep roads was worth the trip itself. Highly recommended if you have twenty minutes to spare.

We started our bike tour at the top of mount Soledad and made our way down to the beach... Gorgeous views of all of La Jolla and San Diego! Nice tribute to veterans as well.

On top of this mountain you can see the entire San Diego with 360 degree view. There is no admission and parking is free. The place also have a memorial to honor veterans who gave up their lives for our country. Go there in late afternoon and stay there to enjoy the sunset. Bring a hat and a jacket because...


More  



Twisty drive up a steep hill! If you drive a standard be forewarned - you will need first gear going up the hill at least once if not twice. Please also note you drive through residential communities to get there. Once you're to the top it is a gorgeous view of San Diego. you can see the Mormon Temple, MCAS...


More  



Family came to visit and wanted to go somewhere up high, so I heard there might be a good vista point on Mt Soledad. We were pleasantly surprised, there is a whole park up there with a beautiful Veterans Monument. Any veteran can be added to the memorial, but the fee is quite expensive. The view was incredible! 180 degree...


More  



The views from Mount Soledad are breathtaking! One has a 360 degree view of San Diego, the Pacific ocean/beach, and La Joya hillside. The memorial and the cross are a must see.

title: La Jolla Shores, La Jolla

La Jolla Shores is, in my opinion and apparently a lot of other people, one of the best beaches in the country. There is a long stretch of sandy beach, it is clean, there are life guards and it is within walking distance of some La Jolla restaurants and shops.

Fine for a chair and for sand castles -- uncomfortable before long on a towel or blanket. Beautiful, clean ocean...

Always something to do...always something to see. Great scuba diving place. Though the steps down and especially up are sometimes tough.

This beach is filthy. It's always crowded. Parking is a nightmare. Even getting there is a nightmare. It takes forever. Traffic is unbelievably bad.

Awesome beach town. This is the perfect getaway all on its own or as part of a San Diego vacation! Spend at least one day in La Jolla!

A must visit stunning place lovely shops and restaurants plus the amazing beach well worth a visit in San diego

Always a great beach but is bit spoiled at the moment.
Prefer PB at the present time. Parking is usually easier at La Jolla Shores, especially if you go early morning.

Great beach to relax at with the kids.
There are essentially no shady areas, just a wide expanse of sand. There are almost no amenities such as shops or restaurants near the beach. Lots of free parking.
The change rooms and toilets were clean, and there were showers to rinse off with.
There is a nice playground that has no...

Our group of eight was welcomed quickly and seated out on the patio. The view was amazing and the weather was perfect. Our service was very slow and the coffee was cold. This is a beautiful clear peaceful beach so just perfect for family trip with kids.
Every option is fine: sunbathing, swimming, surfing, kayaking, strolling.
Only the thing is, they have no enough spaces for parking. So I would recommend to get there early or not, you should tour every alley to find your space.

title: Coronado Bridge, San Diego

Believe it or not, I was afraid to go over this bridge. I have a thing for heights as in, I don't like them. But the bridge was just fine. In fact, as you go over it, you really don't think about the fact you are driving over the ocean. It is what lies over the bridge that is the...

We were lucky to go over both ways without traffic however at rush hour the bridge often appeared to be at a standstill. It is well-designed and easy to navigate.

There's nothing overly spectacular about the bridge itself, minus the fact that it is a little over 2 miles long and approximately 200 feet high. Parents, be warned; people within the island of Coronado like to talk about the suicide history behind the bridge, which may not be the most appropriate thing for young ears.

We drove over it and took a boat ride under it. The bridge is beautiful to look at from the water but even better to drive. The big arch and curve is because to get federal funding it had to be over 2 miles long so they put the big curve and made it 2.2 miles long. It is a...

We drove over the bridge at sunset. Wow what a sight. It is fun bridge to drive on and you can see so much of town. The Island is great to see. Make sure you are not in a hurry traffic is bad and a lot of one way streets.

Really enjoyed spending the day in Coronado. My husband and I are in town to visit our daughter who attends SDSU. Took our daughter and friends to Coronado to walk the beach and have lunch. Parking was difficult but not impossible even with two cars. Walked to the Hotel Coronado and then to the marina. Ate lunch on Orange Street....

Beautiful view of the area from the Bridge! Enjoy a drive and explore Coronado! If you've never driven it, drive it at least once!

Coronado island is a great place for beach and a plethora of amazing restaurants... The bridge is free and has great views of the surrounding San Diego areas

We took an Uber over the bridge and our driver was great describing everything we saw while on the bridge. You can see Mexico and a great San Diego sky line.

Zoo, Sea World, Midway, Old Town, three different beaches and of course tour 's San Diego on the trolley.

title: Torrey Pines Gliderport, La Jolla
address: 2800 Torrey Pines Scenic Dr, La Jolla, San Diego, CA 92037
review_list:

Great spot to grab a sandwich and watch the colorful gliders sail off the steep cliffs. On days with no wind they don't take off but still great views of the Pacific!

What a great place to sit on the deck and watch the thrill seekers run off the cliff into the wind! The gliders are colorful and beautiful to watch floating over the ocean and cliffs. Went out of the way to see hang gliders but when we got there they weren't flying. One person said there wasn't enough wind, another said there was too much wind!? Not sure if there's a way to check and see if they're flying before making the trip?

one of the most beautiful places in california for paragliding
you can fly over the ocean whit a nice view of the mansions

The view...

title: SeaWorld San Diego, San Diego

I was very much anti sea world for a long time! In fact until i visited San Diego!

After viewing this, go down the hill by the tide pools and see the new automatic lighthouse.
There's something healthy for humanity about a lighthouse....
Yes yes yes

it is located at point loma. there is a good view of the sea and the city. the sea breeze was great too!

title: Mormon Battalion Historic Site, San Diego
address: 2510 Juan Street, San Diego, CA
review_list:
I was expecting more preaching, but this was really about a little piece of American history I didn't know about. The talking exhibit was well done, and the guides were friendly and knowledgeable.

title: San Diego Bay Walk, San Diego
address: San Diego, CA
review_list:
There are some wonderful sights along the bay walk. Shops, restaurants and boats abound. There are almost always lots of people walking along but there is plenty of room on the wide sidewalks. I used the walk to go between hotels for meetings, instead of walking on the street. It was nice to get a little fresh air and sunshine after hours in conference rooms.

Awesome views along the bay. Lots of cool shops and restaurants too. There are a couple of parks that you can run and exercise in. Up close views of Navy vessels, especially aircraft carriers. super cool!

There was a car show at the convention center and part of it flowed out onto the Bay Walk. There were many street performers, vendors, and interesting people that made the walk an experience in...


More  



Lots to see and do walking around the bay, shops, restaurants, boat tours and even an aircraft carrier to visit.

This is walk that has constantly changing view. Lots to see and do and is a buzzing hive of activity as the sun goes down.

San Diego is a laid back city full of free things to do with the added benefit of great weather. So this is a pretty good walk, very comfortable. And you can see a lot of boats and not too far away is the airport and airliner watching can be done, too. Above all, we like watching people enjoying themselves.

We spent New Year's Day walking along the San Diego Bay. It's a lovely setting, with great views. A terrific way to start the new year!

We walked along the path at San Diego Bay to get some exercise and were pleasantly surprised by the gorgeous view of downtown San Diego. It was New Year's Day and the weather was a perfect 72 degrees! We saw all kinds of sailboats and motor boats. We would definitely do this again!

Went to see the "Grinch" and not only is the place very special but the stage craft is phenomenal and a world class performance.

we saw Last Gallop. Went with the seat recommendation of the ticketing office attendant. Easy access, great seating in the round so there are no bad seats. Would certainly go to another production in this venue.

awesome beach; the beach walk is great. Lots of fabulous views. Good spots to stop for drinks, eats.

Premium outlet featuring many high-end brands on a 2-level shopping mall. Lots of seats and a food court for men who need a break while their wives & gfs shop for deals. This place is accessible by the Green Line and is only 15 minutes from downtown San Diego.

My disability prevented me climbing down the 142 steps to the Cave itself, which was a shame, as apparently it is evocative of smuggling days. But the view from above was impressive (try and ignore the smell), as was the sound as the waves crashed in and out. Loved the little shop above the cave entrance, with quirky items and...

I didnt pay to go down sunny jims tunnel. But the shop where you do go down into the tunnel is pretty cool and so are the views from all around the cave.

My family loves these cliffs and park and views of the pacific. Again, we do this daily while we are here.

What's $5 these day? You drink that amount at Starbucks ! It's worth the admission to explore the cave great photo ops but make sure you use your flash or the pics won't turn out

$5 seems like a great deal to check out the caves- right? Well, it is, sort of. the $5 gets you access to the steps that walk you down to a landing in a cave where the waves splash in. Yup, that's it. You rented some steps. I'm not saying its not worth it but don't expect much. The steps...

To see the waves coming in and out, to hear to echo of seals inside the caves and the beautiful greenery full of sea birds along the edge....all of this and more makes for a spectacular view and well worth taking the time to see.

WE enjoyed all the above places. We felt we got a really good overview of the LaJolla area. Mount Soladad very impressive!

The sea side case are neat to look at and there is a great walk along the hillside so that you can check out multiple views.

Classic California waterfront walkway for enjoying the scenic display and variety of every type of sail and motor boats.
The area invokes a serene, and relaxing atmosphere.

What a great way to be a part of the San Diego environment.

Harbor Island, close to the airport with Hilton and Sheraton, and a good restaurant with views of the bay at on tip are more expensive. Shelter also has Osprey platform (eagle family) and...

A wonderful paved path adjacent to the water, perfect for walking. Marina area where seal and pelicans abound. Promenade for strolling. Pier and boat launch area. About 4 large several story hotels line the shore area. Both locations have nice views of the harbor and the downtown skyline. Very nice sidewalks that run the whole length of the Islands. Very popular with walkers and joggers. There are several hotels and restaurants all in walking distance. Parking is free but can be difficult to find sometimes.

A must when visiting San Diego is a stroll through these Islands specially through Shelter Island. Great parks with playgrounds for kids.

We always stay on Shelter Island when we visit San Diego. There is a little beach and a playground for the kids. It's the perfect place to watch the ships go by.

title: Mission San Diego de Alcala, San Diego
address: 10818 San Diego Mission Road, San Diego, CA 92108
review_list:
Being mission lovers, who have visited several missions throughout California, we were looking forward to visiting the FIRST mission in the state. First off, the mission was difficult to find. Despite being located off Mission Rd, there is a lack of signage and it's somewhat confusing to find. Once we finally found the mission, we were disappointed that there wasn't...


More  



Thoroughly enjoyed our tour of the mission. It is beautifully re-done and the Grand kids found it fascinating. All in all a lovely couple of hours in San Diego.

This was very easy to get to from the train station. You can take the trolley and it's 2 blocks away. They have knowledgable docents and very small crowds. Great place to take photographs. Easy walk around for everyone.

A loving restoration of the original mission church in California. The grounds are beautifully maintained and add to the charm. There were amazing artifacts but many were lacking full descriptions which would have made them much more relevant...200 or more year old vestments and chalices with no explanations...only downside.

A fascinating couple of hours was spent here reading about the history of the missionaries in California. Plenty to see and do, and shopping malls aplenty close by...

Definitely worth a trip. Minimal entry fee lets you wander freely around the grounds. The only thing to be aware of is that it is actually a functioning catholic church, so there are services on Sunday and people frequently schedule weddings here.

Nice mission. Hadn't realized this was the first mission established in California. The museum is especially nice with well documented history & artifacts. The Basilica is nice with some interesting features. Stop in the gift shop & pay the small fee (I think it was $3 for seniors) & take the self-guided tour.

Located just above Old Town San Diego, the mission has a lot of history and museum items on display. One of the chain of missions built by Father Serra up the California coast. Very nice grounds.

This was an amazing place to visit. It is a lovely church that has not changed since the 1700's. In the museum part, tells the history of the church and the Missionaries. It shows how they lived, where they slept, and the grounds are very lovely. Very friendly staff.

I was lucky to stumble upon this mission as I was passing through. It's an important piece of CA history and, as a tourist, should be better publicized. (Help..Chamber of Commerce).
Altho I missed mass (the confessional awaits), I was in awe of the peaceful garden & scenery.
Skip the junky tourist trap stores. Mosey over to their store; it...

This pier is a great place to really experience California. The day we were there, the waves were crashing all around, and it was a great view of the surfers and the water. On really windy days, however, the pier closes for safety reasons, so check before venturing out.

Ocean Beach is even dirtier and grimier and full of tourists and sketchy characters than it was when we lived there in the 70s. Still has good eats, shops and interesting sights to watch. Awesome antique stores too.

Ocean Beach is arguably one of the coolest spots in California. It's the type of cool that doesn't even know it's cool. I love the laid back atmosphere, the excellent climate and the well chilled people who live here. Great shops, great food and great bars. It's a haven!

The way all California beach towns should be and probably once were. There's a pier with a small cafe on it. Not the best walking beach but it has a couple of good restaurants/bars overlooking it too for breakfast, lunch, happy hour and dinner. And definitely for people who love their dogs.

At high tide the waves on the south side are surfable: To the north by the river mouth is an off leash dog beach. Low tide exposes a nice deep sandy playground.

The beach has beautiful soft sand. We really enjoyed watching the surfers catch waves. We didn't go into the water here, though, because of the disconcerting amount of seaweed & some bugs here. We preferred La Jolla's beaches much more.

Ocean Beach is one of the most unique and colorful places in San Diego. Its quaint Main Street (Newport Avenue)has shops and restaurants that have been there for decades. The beach is beautiful and often serene. Many great places to shop, eat and observe.

The ocean is the hi-lite but all the neat little shops, eateries and pubs along the strip is really good. Lots of history and sights here and an easy going relaxing way to spend an afternoon.

It's old school!
a nice community and shops everywhere you go! From Ice cream to Antique shops, bathing suits and surf shops! all in walking distance. great beach to just park yourself and enjoy the views. Sunset, out of this world! Park in state park area, reasonable and good access.

I want to come here every weekend! This beach is gorgeous! I love hiking up the cliffs and then strolling back to my car on the waters edge. Perfect

I wouldn't make the trip up there just for the beach. But it will be a great way to cool off after a nice long hike on the mountain trails.

walking trails, volunteers to help guide [low tide]. Good photos

Head up to the lighthouse. $10 parking fee. Head on down to the waters edge and hike along the cliffs.

Just a neat thing to see in San Diego, you can see some fun sea life and explore the shoreline. A nice relaxing place to visit.

Construction of new retainer walls and larger boardwalk. Beach is just as great as ever. We had fun walking along and enjoying the view and the people. Great place to spend the day, week, month or lifetime!

Currently some construction is going on, so keep your eyes open for different forms of traffic on the boardwalk. Plenty of rental areas, restaurants, and shops. You could also continue your walk all the way up to La Jolla.

Beautiful beach with many friendly strollers, exercisers, skaters along the boardwalk. The entire Mission Bay/Sail Bay area has a contiguous walking trail. The boardwalk is just the start. You can literally walk 5 or more miles in comfort without stepping on anything scary. It's clean and safe too. Get a map and plan your walk so you know how far you're going to go.

Nice wide beach, kept clean with enough food/beverage options to make your day enjoyable> Also has a grass park area if you want to get out of the sand. Rented a house nearby so was able to easily walk to the beach.

If you are tired of dodging bikes, joggers and crowds walking on the same walking path you are on, this is a good uncrowded place to go. It borders a beautiful bay and offers both a lot to see and a good walk.

Campus is large & pretty. I wouldn't say this is a must see unless you are a potential college student

Fantastic overall experience! Great arena, hospitable fans and a great selection of food. A total winner!

Exploring the campus with all of the sculpture is a pleasant way to spend a few hours. The snake walkway is the "highlight" followed by the "Cant i the Hat" sculpture.

Free Sunday concert. Music if David Bowie was awesome. We were here visiting museums and lucked out to see and hear this pipe organ concert.

Came to the pavilion for a New Years Day concert at 2pm. They also do weekly concerts at 2pm on Sundays. Post concert, you can visit the pavilion and check out the pipes and tubes. We attended the Spreckels Sunday afternoon pipe organ concert, held every Sunday afternoon at 2:00p. The admission is free-donations accepted. The concert was great and during the second half you are invited to tour through the 4700 pipe organ while the concert is in progress - awesome! It is a very worthwhile event.

It is an amazing organ and what can be bad about sitting in the sun listening to music.
Sometimes the music is a little dirge but still it is free and a great pc of history.
Being outside there is plenty of room to roam around and still enjoy.
Then wander around Balboa Park a little.

It is not December without checking out Spreckels during December with all the Christmas decorations and music. It's perfect for a date or night out with the family. Time it well and you might be there for the open houses and festival with all the international houses.

We went for their Christmas Celebration opening of their Nativity Scenes and the orchestra was great, the hot cocoa and chocolate chip cookies perfect and over all atmosphere was fun! It's also so much fun to see the planes fly by as you watch the orchestra do their thing!

It possibly was going to rain, so the console was kept close to the building. Our fortune. We were able to set just behind the organist.
The program was a mixture of genre's, to show off the instrument's breadth of capability.
We felt very fortunate to have a chance to be in the right place at the right time.

It was great to finally be in the park when they held one of their free concerts. I stuck around for 20 or so minutes listening to real classic music. Great place for kids. Parking is a problem, but you can always find a space if you keep driving around. Lots of fun and nice shopping.

There is so much to do right in belmont park and it sits beautifully on the bay. We played mini golf there which was a very easy course but still fun. We loved all of the little games you can play like the photoboths or basketball to win prizes. They had some really cool restaurants in the park too. Wave...

We were looking for the beach and came across this great place. Cheap rides and the arcade was fun. Very nice fun for the family!

We try to go once a month on a Sunday mid-afternoon so there is parking available. Our 2-year old son has a great walking through the shops and riding the carousal and other kiddie rides.

Fun spot on the beach. Had a blast at Tiki Town Adventure Golf & arcade was great! Lots to do here with climbing wall, roller coaster, shops & restaurants. Fun for all ages!

Old fashioned amusement park with rattly wooden coaster. Great for people looking for fun the old fashioned way

My niece loves the beach, roller coasters, after hours for those under 21, tatoo parlors, cheap eats, and it's all there in one area. If this is your thing, this is the place to go!!!

It is a good idea but all the exciting rides are down for maintenance.... Kinda good if they need it I guess. But they just looked closed. Signature roller coast is what we went for. Maybe next time....

As a family we travel America to ride roller coasters. We could not miss this one after visiting San Diego. Thankfully, its free to enter the Park and you only pay for what you want to do. title: Dog Beach, San Diego
address: Point Loma, Ocean Beach, San Diego, CA
review_list:
My dog loves the beach and this is the place he likes to go. If your dog likes the beach he will like this place too. FYI dog beach is full of sand so your dog will get sandy, bring a towel. Also please pick up after your dog. No one like to see poop on the beach.

I loved this beach! Everyone was really friendly and laid back. They have plenty of potty bags but no water so make sure to bring enough water for your dogs. It's really big but there's no fence so if your dog likes to run away make sure you keep him leashed. Overall it was a great place!

This is a great place to let the dogs (we took 4 of our 6 with us) run free in the sand and surf. Wide open area and everyone was friendly. Only downfalls are limited parking and no nearby amenities for the humans so be sure to pack everything you need.

This is a great place. We were on vacation and were missing our pups. We had so much fun. Watching the dogs play and run in the ocean was a blast. Dogs would come up to me with ball for me to throw, others just wanted to say hi. Loved it!!!

A friend and I took our dogs for their first road trip from Las Vegas to San Diego, we got a dog motel on the Dog Beach. This beach is just great, we could walk from our motel, the beach is clean, the water is so beautiful. You are allowed to have you dogs off leash if you trust them....


More  



The beach was clean, responsible owners ,and friendly happy dogs. If you are visiting the area, Pet Smart La Jolla has the nicest doggy day care, hotel. We left our two dogs there while we visited the area and didn't want to leave them in the hotel.

This beach was so fun. Off leash and with 4 border collies it was great to see then run play and swim. Lots of sand dollars( unbroke). So many I was amazed. Dogs loved it. We stay about 4 hours. Will be going back for sure.

I am not much on dogs. So when my daughter made me go I was not so sure I would enjoy this kind of beach. Anyway it is an experience to enjoy no matter how different it might be. The dogs are just like big kids. Seeing their friends and running off to play. Enjoy!

We came without a pup, but enjoyed the shared company of those who did have their canine friend with them. This beach is geared for the dog owner, period. Perfect too! (Don't bring your cat!)

San Diego's to be complimented for setting aside this place where dogs and their people can enjoy the ocean. Always innovative. Exceptionally well produced. Extremely interesting. Hard to imagine why there aren't lines a mile long for the Playhouse productions. You get to see art being born!

Short walk from the parking area. Theater staff are outside the buildings to help you find the correct theater (there are 3). Seats are comfortable, with good views of the stage. Professional actors, excellent productions.

In La Jolla, this is where one shops--most of the high end shops are here, although we have lost a few recently, but is a wonderful place to walk around and at least window-shop. be aware though there are no parking meters, and the free parking is two hours--they mean it!

Don't get me wrong, it's a nice area. There are awesome eateries and some cool things to do (Tidal Pool for one). Parking is a nightmare or expensive. Tons of people swarm the place. Traffic can take forever.

This cross roads is like a Rodeo Drive or El Paseo Drive with a beach in the heart of La Jolla, this area has something for every traveler. The variety of boutique hotels, shopping, restaurants, galleries and people watching is endless on every budget

There is a wonderful variety of gift shops and boutiques in this area. It's La Jolla so expect to pay more but the quality of the merchandise is excellent. Good bars as well.

Ok, let me be honest, I live in San Diego. Love to take visitors to this area even though prices are double, triple and more than what they are in the rest of San Diego. By the way, La Jolla is not a separate town, it is a neighborhood of the city of San Diego. You'll find all sorts of...


More  



Even though we live only 20 minutes away, my spouse and I enjoy strolling along Girard and Prospect Streets because the shops are always getting new and interesting merchandise. For instance, the floral shop on Girard had some of the most unusual, lovely proteas we had ever seen on display. I can always find the perfect gift in Warrick’s Bookstore...


More  



Enjoyed walking the area after lunch. Quite a few interesting shops and small galleries. Lots of dining options. Parking is difficult but can be found. Valet parking available for a price, of course.

title: San Diego Mormon Temple, La Jolla
address: 7474 Charmant Drive, La Jolla, San Diego, CA 92122-5000
review_list:
This was just off Interstate 5, and we stopped and took pictures, their were guides to answer questions, and we also walked around and took several photo shots.

Nestled right next to Interstate Highway 5, the Mormon Temple is an awesome sight, particularly when it is lit up at night. Of course, if you're not Mormon, you will not be allowed to go inside, but the outside is very impressive and makes for some great photos.

But you can not come inside...??? We were so disappointed because our parents who at 80s and wanted to come in to look and take some pictures but you are not allowed to get inside!!!

All you can do is drive-by and admire this temple as it is closed to the public; however, if you're in the La Jolla, UTC area, it's well worth your time to drive by and/or stop a moment to admire the beauty of the white on white with gold angel architecture! I had opportunity to tour it before it was...


More  



There is such a peaceful feeling as you walk the grounds. The views are fantastic both in the day and at night with the lights on.

Kinda different from most vacation attractions but we enjoyed the peaceful atmosphere and the very nice people. The architecture was amazing and we found out what an important role it plays in the San Diego history. Beautiful grounds and Very cool.

The building and grounds are beautiful. This has always been my favorite Temple because it looks like a castle from a fairy tale. We were there in November and the Christmas lights were already up and they were breath taking.

This temple is one of the most beautiful buildings in San Diego and is easily seen from the freeway. At christmas they put up lots of lights and have live music for the public to enjoy. You can't go inside unless you're a member of the church, but you can enjoy the grounds and the beautiful building free of charge....


More  



We could see the lights from afar, and drove over in person to see the display of holiday celebration lights. The grounds and design make this a must see.

Some of the most iconic buildings throughout the ages have had religious contentions. This Morman church is no different and is well worth the visit to La Jolla. An absolutely stunning structure, to be viewed during the day and at night when lighted. All the more special at Christmas and really sets the seasonal scene. Photographs do not do this...


More

This large brewery has it going on, you walk in and it rocks with bodies! Large brewery! Newer and clean! We enjoyed the merchandise area! Their beer is solid and food at the brewery is local source and yummy!

Beer are of high quality. We had a lot of fun. The cool thing, whithin whole san diego, are the tasters. These small glass offers you to try a whole range of beers without the excessive satteration beet brings. Loved it

While staying in the Gas Lamp we drove up to India Street especially to drink here. Well worth it!! Great beer selection of their own products, as well as other wonderful beers. Good pub food too and nice gift shop.

I meet work colleagues here whilst on a business trip and loved the place! As well as the dozens of beer son offer the food in the restaurant was superb; not fine dining but quality bar food and a bit more.

Not a huge beer drinker so went for the Spirits Tasting. Luckily we arrived a half hour before it started. There are 2 tastings/tours, beer and spirits and they are separate so check ahead for times. Let me start that I don't even like beer and I had a great time. we started out in the restaurant and had a great lunch. The rest of the people I went with enjoyed tasting the beer as well. we then went on a tour of the brewery our tour guide was both fun and informative and I really...

If you're a beer lover, this place is a must go! It was one of the best experiences I had in San Diego. Just don't go by yourself, it would be kind of depressive since you'll find tables with big groups and stuff.

San Diego is renowned for its craft beer breweries, and for me this was the pick of the bunch. An incredible range, each intricately described by the very knowledgeable and friendly bartender. They also have a small food menu, and the burger I had was delicious. If I lived in San Diego, this would be my regular bar.

title: Ellen Browning Scripps Park, La Jolla
address: 1133 Coast Blvd, La Jolla, San Diego, CA 92037
review_list:
The sea lions were up on the rocks while I visited the park. While there were more people than I expected for 10am on a Sunday, the park didn't feel too crowded at all. Parking was tricky, but I was lucky enough to snag a front row spot.

Good:
Views
Sunsets
Shopping
Lots of Grass
Bad:
Parking
Privacy
Quiet
Smokers
Stinky:
Sea life
Birds
Smokers

Great grassy area with a view of the water near La Jolla Cove. Relax, hang out, people watch. Parking can be a challenge especially on weekends.

There are not too many amenities at Scripps Park. There are a couple of picnic tables and a bathroom and I'm not sure anything more than that. What is lacks in amenities though, it more than makes up for with amazing views and weather. The view along the pathway is amazing. The park is always clean and rarely crowded other...


More  



This is part of the entire La Jolla experience. When visiting the seals and sea lions you will be walking around the park. Great place to sit and have a snack, read or just enjoy the ocean. In the summers they have music on Sunday's along with other activities throughout the year. You might not want to leave!

This Park is a wonderful place to walk by the Pacific Ocean. You will find places to stop and watch the seals, cormorants and pelicans, as well as kayakers. There is room for picnics, or to play frisbee or just sit and soak up the sun. If you plan on picnicking be sure to put any liquids in non-glass containers...


More  



I've celebrated a few birthdays at this park. Bring some chairs and prepare to spend the day lounging about the picturesque park.

Nice small park rite on the ocean. Well-kept lawn and area. Lots of children playing in the area. Parking is available close-by (if you can find a spot). Just a couple of blocks of the main drag and good for "people watching"

Wide open spaces next to the ocean with beautiful old trees. Plenty of area to sit and relax, picnic with friends, or walk your dog. Clean and safe.

My partner and I (in 40s) stopped in here on a day trip to the Salk Institute and Torrey Pines. It's not overly large - so don't expect SeaWorld (as I think some people do) - but it's good quality.
If you take the time to really look at the displays, they are remarkable. And, the feeding area is cool...

title: A National Salute to Bob Hope & the Military, San Diego
address: Tuna Harbor Park, San Diego, CA
review_list:
Whilst probably not worth a special visit on its own, when combined with a long stroll along the harbourside it is well-worth the short extra detour alongside the impressive USS Midway.
The statues are extremely life-like and very representational of different arms of the Forces. Playing back a Bob Hope speech through loudspeakers really added to the atmosphere and underlined...


More  



Very cool memorial with an audio of some of Bob's best jokes playing on a loop over speakers. Great view of the USS Midway and the harbor. Don't miss this attraction.

The Salute to Bob Hope and the Military exhibit is located right on the water front, between the Fish Market Restaurant and the USS Midway. The exhibit, dedicated to Bob Hope and the military he entertained for decades is worth a bit of time. The part where Mr. Hope is in front of the troops cracking jokes was very typical...


More  



Life-size sculptures representing a vignette of Bob Hope entertaining the troops was a pleasant surprise while we were visiting the Midway Museum. A photo op it was to my family! We posed among the Military and took photos.

The art is well done and in the shadow of the USS MIDWAY, it gives a real sense of how Bob Hope dedicated his talents to service in his own way. The path to get to this memoriart is equally part of the overall deal. All of the statues and memorials lining the path are terrific and worth stopping to...


More  



Check this out as you make your way along the San Diego waterfront/Embarcadero. It's a funky little park with statues of Hope and military figures from different eras. Loud speakers play parts of Hope's USO performances. Right beside this is a colossal reproduction of the famous photo a sailor kissing a nurse at the end of WWII (which actually took...


More  



Whoever put this Tribute together did an outstanding job. The audio of Bob Hope talking to the troops pulls it all together. Seeing the various sculptures of soldiers was exquisite and thoughtful. It only takes about 20 min to visit so fit it into your schedule! You will laugh and smile.

This is literally across from Midway, in the pleasant small park along the water and is well done. It is overshadowed by the gigantic statue of the sailor kissing the nurse (as in the famous End of World War II photograph from Times Square). Don't miss it.

This is what can happen when we properly salute our military's greatest ambassador and give a respectful tribute that is well deserved.
If your from out of town start here,find parking at the Fish Market restaurant, bring comfortable shoes, camera, water, thirst for naval history and then take a nice walk down past the Midway to the Maritime Museum along...


More  



Bob Hope should have a special place in every veteran's heart who served up through the first Gulf War. This is a wonderful tribute to Bob who loved our men and women in uniform. The statues represent each era that Hope entertained the troops and is extremely well done. Worth a visit.

title: Shell Beach Tide Pools, La Jolla
address: Coast Highway, Ellen Browning Scripps Park, La Jolla, San Diego, CA
review_list:
This place was absolutely breathtaking! The views are amazing, kids loved it, we loved it. So glad we didn't skip this gem!

Lots of shells if you go at the right time of day, fun for the whole family or romantic in the evening if you and your special someone want to take a walk!

One of the last unspoiled shoreline areas where mico-marine environments can be found in small tidal pools in the rock. Such wonders visible to the naked eye! Anemones, spiny sea urchins, fish, snails etc... The beauty and diversity are overwhelming. And the price is right ;)

title: University of San Diego USD, San Diego
address: 5998 Alcala Park, San Diego, CA 92110
review_list:
It's a university campus. We're sorry, but as pleasant as it is, it's fairly standard fare. Unless you have a friend or family member attending there, we don't really see a large reason to visit.

USD is often called the University of Spoiled Daughters, which is not fair. There are also spoiled sons there. In all seriousness, USD is a prestigious Jesuit university situated on the top of Mission Valley. It has beautiful views and amazing programs. The have a world-class Peace institute as well as a great array of BA and MA programs.

This campus is one of the loveliest in the nation. I recommend visiting when classes are not in session so that you can easily park and visit some of the buildings and classrooms. Founder's Chapel is particularly special and worth visiting. Have lunch at either the Gran Terraza--it is reasonably priced with great views, or if you are a large...

One classy place. Took my daughter there on her college tour - fabulous architecture, lots of tradition.

If you are looking for a great education on an absolutely beautiful campus, the University of San Diego, known by San Diegans as USD cannot be beat. That said, tuition is quite high!

One of the best and most popular campuses in the California UC system. Located on the bluffs above the beautiful Pacific Ocean. Southern California's premier undergraduate and graduate studies premier institute of research and learning.

crowded--poor parking; Otherwise a typical California University. Blahh, Blahh, Blah. Am I at 100 words yet ?

The La Gran Terraza restaurant located on the campus if a beautiful room and view. Food is excellent especially their special prime rib dinner nights. In addition they do wine dinners that are excellent and a lot of fun. Great wit staff.

Like all UC campuses, UCSD has a range of architecture styles, some quite pretty and others very institutional. Also like all UC campuses, there are some nice walks and pretty sights.
All of that said, I'm not sure that I would go out of my way to visit UCSD unless you had some other reason to visit.

review_list:
It contains the country's largest collection of outdoor murals in this immigrant community of central San Diego. Chicano Park, like Berkeley's People's Park, was the result of a militant (but nonviolent) people's land takeover. Efforts continue to restore mural, renovate restrooms in midst of highway overpass construction and general development (that has impacted neighborhood of Logan Barrio over the years). This area of San Diego had been continuously inhabited by Mexicans, then Mexican-Americans, since far earlier than the founding of the United States. I had a great time running in Balboa park with Josh. 3.5 miles around Balboa Park was an excellent way to see this beautiful park. Josh was very knowledgeable about the city. He was a great your guide. Beautiful view too! I highly recommend this run.

Great, friendly guide with lots of info and suggestions of where to go. I loved running through San Diego- taking the photos was a nice touch.

Awesome run through the San Diego Gaslamp Quarter and the Embarcadero Area in the early morning during sunrise. A great way to start your San Diego trip!

My daughter and I took a personalized running tour of downtown San Diego with Josh and had a good time. Josh customized the route to fit our running ability and schedule.
